javadoc: SubroutineDestReferenceIterator is a unidirectional iterator over the destination CodeBlockReferences for a CodeBlock.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct an Iterator over Destination blocks for a CodeBlock.
 External references will be ignored.

params.name: block
params.comment:
block to get destination blocks for.  This should be a
 subroutine obtained from PartitionCodeSubModel.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor which allows user to cancel operation.

throws.comment: if the monitor cancels the operation.

methods.name: getNumDestinations
methods.comment:
Get number of destination references flowing out of this subroutine (block).
 All Calls from this block, and all external FlowType block references
 from this block are counted.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the number of destination references from.

methods.name: getDestinations
methods.comment:
Count and queue all destination references flowing out of this subroutine (block).
 All Calls from this block, and all external FlowType block references
 from this block are counted.

params.name: block
params.comment: code block to get the number of destination references from.

params.name: blockRefQueue
params.comment: the CodeBlockReference queue, may be null

methods.name: queueDestReferences
methods.comment:
Create destination block reference(s) and add to the blockRefQueue if not null.
 A valid CodeBlock must exist at the destAddr for a reference to be added and/or counted.

params.name: blockRefQueue
params.comment: the CodeBlockReference queue, may be null

params.name: srcBlock
params.comment: the source block associated with the CodeBlockReference(s)

params.name: flowType
params.comment: the flow type to be associated with reference.

name: SubroutineDestReferenceIterator
comment:
SubroutineDestReferenceIterator is a unidirectional iterator over 
 the destination CodeBlockReferences for a CodeBlock.
